body: @timdorr eh, we've got that "history/philosophy" page, but we don't have a "Usage Guide" page that talks about "how to write a middleware properly", which is what I was thinking of from that other thread :)
I'm confused, because that's literally what that page covers (best practices and things to avoid)

Hmm. Re-reading it... I agree there's some of that info in there, sort of.  But A) that page has always been pretty confusing to read in general ("here's 6 ways to write middleware that _don't work_!"), and it's also not structured as a "here's how to do this" page.

What I'm picturing would cherry-pick some of the info from "Fundamentals Part 4: Store > Middleware", then go into more details on what you can and can't do inside, why a middleware should end up doing some form of `return next(action)` to avoid breaking the return chain, etc.

Yeah, I would not have searched for this in a section called "History and Design". I would assume that I only need to read that when contributing to the library itself, but not when writing my own additions.
If there is interest, I'm happy to provide a PR along the lines of what @markerikson suggested.

Worth making a note that middleware can run logic both before _and_ after the reducer updated the state - just depends on where you place the `next(action)` call:

- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75355986/reacting-to-changes-in-derived-state-with-redux/75356462?noredirect=1#comment132990467_75356462
Based on [the twitter discussion](https://twitter.com/acemarke/status/1623041113790550030), I can set up a PR some time next week I think :)
Took a bit longer, but I'll start on this now and expect a PR to be ready later today.

issue.title: Add documentation page "Writing Custom Middleware"

repository.name: redux
repository.description: A JS library for predictable global state management

issue.body:
Fixes #4472

---
name: :book: New/Updated Documentation Content
about: Adding a new docs page, or updating content in an existing docs page
---

## PR Type

Add a page

## Checklist

- [X] Is there an existing issue for this PR?
  - #4472 
- [X] Have the files been linted and formatted?

## What docs page is being added or updated?

- **Section**: Usage Guide/Using Redux/Redux Logic and Patterns
- **Page**: Writing Custom Middleware

## For Adding New Content

### What kind of content category is this page (tutorial, how-to, explanation, reference)?

How-to

### Who is the intended target audience?

Developers thinking about writing their own middleware with low to medium experience with Redux.

#### What knowledge are we assuming they have?

How to use Redux and middleware in general, but not how to write middleware.

### What are the intended results or takeaways from reading this page?

- Understanding what middleware can do
- Understanding when to write custom middleware vs. using existing packages
- Understanding how to write middleware that is compatible with other Redux middleware like RTK Query middleware

### What is the most critical info they should learn?

- That they most likely shouldn't write custom middleware

body: @markerikson  I've created a PR #4498 awaiting your feedback
